content:
IListenerChannelCallback Interface

Definition

Provides listener-channel notifications from protocol handlers to the worker process framework. Also enables protocol handlers to access additional parameters, such as the ID of the listener channel.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("dc3b0a85-9da7-47e4-ba1b-e27da9db8a1e")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IListenerChannelCallback

Remarks

IListenerChannelCallback is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Methods

GetBlob(Byte[], Int32)

Retrieves data that the protocol manager will pass to a listener channel when the protocol manager is starting that listener channel.

public void GetBlob (byte[] buffer, ref int bufferSize);
Parameters
buffer
Byte[]

The data that will be passed to the listener channel.

bufferSize
Int32

The amount of data, in bytes, that is in the buffer.

Remarks

GetBlob is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

GetBlobLength()

Gets the size of the buffered data in the listener channel.

public int GetBlobLength ();
Returns
Int32

The size, in bytes, of the data that is in the listener channel buffer.

Remarks

GetBlobLength is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

GetId()

Gets the ID of a listener channel that has to be started.

public int GetId ();
Returns
Int32

The ID of the listener channel.

Remarks

GetId is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

ReportMessageReceived()

Notifies the worker process framework that a new message was received.

public void ReportMessageReceived ();

Remarks

This method supports the ASP.NET infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

ReportMessageReceived is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

ReportStarted()

Notifies the worker process framework that a listener channel has started.

public void ReportStarted ();

Remarks

ReportStarted is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

ReportStopped(Int32)

Notifies the worker process framework that a listener channel has stopped.

public void ReportStopped (int hr);
Parameters
hr
Int32

The HRESULT value that reports the status of a listener channel.

Remarks

ReportStopped is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.
